decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing control cards and powerful planeswalkers to manipulate the board state and control the game. By using cards like Supreme Verdict, Detention Sphere, and Banishing Light, the deck aims to remove threats from the opponent's side of the battlefield. It also has card draw and life gain through Sphinx's Revelation to maintain card advantage and stay ahead in the game. The inclusion of powerful planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion and Kiora, the Crashing Wave, allows for additional control and win conditions. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent.

The main concept of this Orzhov Control deck is to utilize a variety of removal spells and hand disruption cards to control the board and prevent the opponent from executing their game plan effectively. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Pack Rat, Desecration Demon, Blood Baron of Vizkopa, and Obzedat, Ghost Council to apply pressure and close out the game quickly once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The deck aims to establish board dominance and maintain control throughout the match to secure the victory.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly dealing damage to the opponent using burn spells like Lightning Strike, Warleader's Helix, and Skullcrack, as well as efficient creatures like Young Pyromancer and Chandra's Phoenix. Chained to the Rocks helps control the opponent's creatures, while Boros Charm provides versatility. The deck also runs removal like Searing Blood and Magma Jet to clear the way for attacks. The mana base includes lands that can produce both red and white mana to ensure consistent casting of spells.

The main focus of this deck is to establish control over the game through a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Dissolve, Detention Sphere, and Supreme Verdict, the deck aims to control the board and disrupt the opponent's plans. Additionally, cards like Sphinx's Revelation and Font of Fortunes provide card draw and lifegain to ensure the player can outvalue their opponent in the long run. This deck's strategy revolves around maintaining board control and card advantage until it can win the game with a powerful finisher like Aetherling or Elspeth, Sun's Champion.

The deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive black creatures and using cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall to control the opponent's board. Devotion to black is key, as it powers up cards like Gray Merchant of Asphodel. Mutavault provides additional creature threats, while Underworld Connections gives card advantage. The deck also includes removal spells like Ultimate Price, Bile Blight, and Devour Flesh to deal with opposing threats. Overall, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with efficient creatures and disruption spells to win the game quickly.

The main focus of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence with low-cost creatures like Cloudfin Raptor and Judge's Familiar, utilizing synergies with cards like Frostburn Weird and Thassa, God of the Sea. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with an aggressive and evasive creature strategy, supported by powerful tempo plays like Cyclonic Rift and Rapid Hybridization. Mutavault and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx provide additional mana sources and versatility for the deck's game plan.

This deck focuses on aggressively building up devotion to black while maintaining a strong presence on the board with powerful black creatures. The key strategy is to quickly swarm the battlefield with creatures like Pack Rat and Gray Merchant of Asphodel, while using removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Hero's Downfall to control the opponent's board. Additionally, the deck utilizes graveyard recursion with Whip of Erebos and card advantage with Underworld Connections to maintain pressure on the opponent and secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on using powerful creatures and removal spells to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The key strategy involves playing threats like Blood Baron of Vizkopa and Desecration Demon, backed up by removal spells such as Hero's Downfall and Bile Blight. Additionally, cards like Thoughtseize and Underworld Connections provide card advantage and disruption, while planeswalkers like Elspeth, Sun's Champion offer additional win conditions. The deck aims to outlast and outgrind opponents, using a combination of threats and control elements to secure victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing cheap and efficient creatures such as Cloudfin Raptor, Judge's Familiar, and Frostburn Weird to quickly build board presence and apply pressure on the opponent. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Master of Waves and Thassa, God of the Sea to close out the game. Additionally, the deck runs disruption in the form of cards like Tidebinder Mage and Nightveil Specter to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of cards like Bident of Thassa and Cyclonic Rift provide additional card advantage and control options.

The main goal of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to quickly build a board presence with low-cost creatures and use them to overwhelm the opponent before they can establish their own game plan. By playing efficient creatures like Cloudfin Raptor, Frostburn Weird, and Nightveil Specter, and combining them with powerful cards like Thassa, God of the Sea and Master of Waves, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure and control the tempo of the game. Additionally, cards like Tidebinder Mage and Cyclonic Rift provide disruption and removal options to further hinder the opponent's strategy.

This deck focuses on aggressively building up Devotion to Black through efficient removal spells, hand disruption, and powerful creatures. By using cards like Thoughtseize and Hero's Downfall to control the board and pack Rat to generate threats, the deck can quickly overwhelm the opponent with powerful devotion-based effects like Gray Merchant of Asphodel and Nightveil Specter. The mana base is optimized to support the strategy while the card draw from Underworld Connections provides constant resources to keep the pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control cards to manage the opponent's threats while generating card advantage through spells like Sphinx's Revelation. By running a combination of counterspells, removal, and planeswalkers like Elspeth and Jace, the deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent. The mana base is designed to support the Esper color combination, allowing for flexibility in casting spells of different colors. A win condition is provided by Aetherling, a difficult-to-answer threat that can close out games quickly.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful creatures and disrupting the opponent's board with removal spells. It utilizes a mix of creatures with strong abilities and powerful threats like Desecration Demon and Obzedat, Ghost Council. The deck also includes support cards like Banishing Light and Hero's Downfall to control the board, while cards like Read the Bones provide card advantage. The deck has a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells to maintain pressure on the opponent while also having ways to gain life and protect its own creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of fast mana acceleration, powerful creatures, and removal spells. The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Elvish Mystic and Sylvan Caryatid to play big threats like Stormbreath Dragon and Polukranos, World Eater. Additionally, cards like Domri Rade and Xenagos, the Reveler provide additional value and card advantage. The inclusion of Ghor-Clan Rampager and Courser of Kruphix helps to push through damage and maintain board presence, while cards like Dreadbore and Abrupt Decay deal with opposing threats efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disrupt their strategy with targeted discard spells like Thoughtseize. By efficiently deploying cheap creatures with powerful abilities like Herald of Torment and Pain Seer, the deck aims to maintain constant pressure on the opponent. Additionally, using cards like Mutavault for added flexibility and utility, the Mono Black Aggro deck looks to close out games swiftly and decisively through a combination of direct damage and creature combat.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a relentless and aggressive strategy utilizing low-cost creatures with evasion abilities, backed up by disruptive spells to control the opponent's hand and board. By combining efficient creatures such as Tormented Hero and Rakdos Cackler with powerful enchantments like Herald of Torment, the deck aims to apply constant pressure and quickly deplete the opponent's life total. The inclusion of removal spells like Ultimate Price and Bile Blight helps maintain board dominance and clear the way for the aggressive creatures to attack freely.
